intro: Legousia arvensis, commonly known as field legousia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. Legousia arvensis is a herbaceous annual that blooms from late spring to early summer.
